history.content: There is no self-nomination or faculty nomination process for the Siebel Scholars program for Berkeley computer science students. The EECS department typically nominates outstanding computer science-focused students for the award from either 1) the pool of admitted, incoming 5-Year MS program students and/or Cal alumni in the MEng program or 2) from the pool of second-year MS-only students in computer science.  The final nominees are vetted by the College of Engineering and the Siebel Scholars Foundation. Awardees are typically notified in August.  The total Siebel Scholarship award per student for 2015-16 was $35,000.  Last year, 3 EECS students received the award.  Please note that Bioengineering also runs a separate Siebel Scholars award process.  For more information about the Berkeley Computer Science Siebel Scholars award or questions about EECS Master's Programs, please contact Michael Sun at msun86@eecs.berkeley.edu

Hey there, 

I don't believe the graduate advisors are on this Piazza page. I have contacted them for more information and will post.

history.content: How do eecs masters students get nominated for the Siebel Scholars program?  Is there anything that a faculty advisor can do to suggest a masters student as a candidate for the program?
